comment.author: 36899742@N00
comment._content: Piping Rock is in Locust Valley on Long Island. According the the date written on the photo, this photo was taken on 6/7/13. New York Times article from 6/8/13 describes this (very rainy) race meet: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C06E1D8143FE6...

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content:
Noel Zia Lee:

Thanks for identifying the location of this race meet as Locust Valley, Long Island and for the date. We will add the information to our source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for Wikipedia in 2009: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piping_Rock_Club The Piping Rock clubhouse was designed by American designer Guy Lowell, and built in 1911. Lowell based his designs on American colonial architecture a desire to link the house with the landscape. Most of the rooms open into a hall which surrounds an internal courtyard.[1] The club hosted the Piping Rock Horse Show from at least 1912 to 1915.[2][3][4] On October 24, 1937 Cole Porter was in a riding accident that crushed his legs, leading to one of them being amputated years later.[5]
